title: The importance of artifacts in AI-assisted programming
partialText: Your AI pair programmer has no memory, which is why proper documentation matters more than ever in AI-assisted development.

title: From Coder to Orchestrator: The future of software engineering with AI
partialText: The software engineering job of the future won't involve writing code; it will involve orchestrating AI agents to write code for you.

title: How GitHub could secure npm
partialText: Why doesn't npm detect compromised packages the way credit card companies detect fraud?

title: A persona-based approach to AI-assisted software development
partialText: Discover how breaking AI assistance into specialized personas can help you tackle complex software development tasks more efficiently and with less frustration.

title: Post to social media using Claude Desktop and Crosspost
partialText: Crosspost is a small utility I wrote to post across social media networks. It now includes an MCP server for use with AI agents.

title: Introducing Mentoss: The fetch mocker
partialText: A new approach to mocking global fetch() calls that works in both browsers and server-side runtimes.

title: Present technical information using a storytelling framework
partialText: Streamline presentations to stakeholders using a storytelling approach.

title: How someone temporarily took over my subdomain
partialText: How an old DNS record set up my subdomain to be occupied by someone else.

title: Backing up my life with a Synology NAS
partialText: Data in a public cloud is out of your control, that's why I decided to create my own private cloud in my office.

title: Managing your to-do-list as a staff+ engineer
partialText: With great agency comes responsibility â€“ to yourself. Learn how to triage your projects and tasks into a structured to-do list.
